description: a(0) = 1; a(n) is obtained by incrementing each digit of a(n-1) by 2.
comments: In A061511-A061522, A061746-A061750 when the incremented digit exceeds 9 it is written as a 2-digit string. So 9+1 becomes the 2-digit string 10, etc.
example: Following 33: 3+2 = 5 and 3+2 = 5, hence the next term is 55.
author: _Amarnath Murthy_, May 08 2001
extensions: More terms from Larry Reeves (larryr(AT)acm.org), May 11 2001
